name: Emerald House
description: The Sevastianov House, also known as Emerald House, is an architectural landmark with Neo-Baroque and Gothic styles. It served various purposes, from housing the Ural Labor Commissariat to hosting international events.

name: Taganay
description: Taganay National Park, located in the Southern Urals, is known for its mountainous terrain, diverse flora, and breathtaking views. It's a favorite destination for hikers and nature enthusiasts.

name: Valday
description: The Valday Hills are home to the Valdaysky National Park, offering serene lakes and rolling hills. The area is celebrated for its natural beauty and cultural significance.

name: Baikal
description: Lake Baikal is the world's deepest freshwater lake and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Known for its crystal-clear water, it's one of Russia's most iconic natural landmarks.

name: Elbrus
description: Mount Elbrus is the highest mountain in Europe and a part of the Caucasus Mountain Range. It is a popular destination for climbers from all over the world.

name: Pillars
description: Krasnoyarsk Stolby National Park is known for its unique rock formations, scenic vistas, and dense forests. It's a popular destination for rock climbers and nature lovers.

name: Spit
description: Kurshskaya Kosa (Curonian Spit) is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its sand dunes, pine forests, and rich biodiversity. The park spans both Russia and Lithuania.

name: Volga
description: The Volga River is the longest river in Europe, flowing through central Russia and into the Caspian Sea. It's historically significant for trade and culture.

name: Vysotsky
description: The Vysotsky skyscraper is a modern architectural landmark and one of the tallest buildings in Yekaterinburg, offering panoramic views of the city.

name: QWERTY
description: The QWERTY Monument is a large sculpture representing a traditional computer keyboard, symbolizing the importance of IT and technology in the city.

name: Plotinka
description: Plotinka is the historic dam that gave rise to Yekaterinburg's industrial development. It is a popular location for locals and tourists alike.

name: Bloody Church
description: The Church on the Blood in Honour of All Saints Resplendent in the Russian Land is a Russian Orthodox church built on the site of the Ipatiev House, where Tsar Nicholas II and his family were executed.
